Package net.objectzoo.events.impl

Class Event0AsyncAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.events.impl.Event0AsyncAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Action0, Action0Async, Event0, Event0AsyncDelegate, Event0Delegate
    public class Event0AsyncAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Event0AsyncDelegate
    The Event0AsyncAdapter is class that adapts an Event0Delegate to Event0AsyncDelegate so that the original delegates subscribers can be invoked asynchronously. All asynchronous event distributions are executed in another thread. The Executor to use for the asynchronous event distributions can be chosen during creation of this helper. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.
    Author:
    tilmann

      • beginStart

        public ActionAsyncResult beginStart​(java.util.function.Consumer<ActionAsyncResult> callback,
                                    java.lang.Object asyncState)
        This beginInvoke implementation invokes all event subscribers in another thread in the order they have been subscribed.
        Specified by:
        beginStart in interface Action0Async
        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of invocation of all event subscribers and receives the same ActionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations ActionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        Returns:
        the ActionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
